Linus and Luke discuss the surprise Black Friday console sales results, where PlayStation and Nintendo dominated while Xbox was outsold by the unexpected Nex Playground, a motion-based family console reminiscent of the Wii and Kinect.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EfQyfM0oQnk

title: Xbox Can't Stop Losing

author: LMG Clips
description:

Dell: https://lmg.gg/dellprowanclips
Secretlab: https://lmg.gg/secretlablmgclips

Linus and Luke discuss a viral experiment where ChatGPT-controlled robots cross safety boundaries, from a humanoid being convinced to shoot its creator with a BB gun to questions around how easily AI safeguards can be bypassed through prompt framing. They also examine recent humanoid robot demos from Tesla and others, debating how real the autonomy is versus hype, teleoperation, and clever marketing.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EfQyfM0oQnk

title: The Robots Are Crashing Out

author: LMG Clips
description:

dbrand: https://dbrand.com/pcb
Dell: https://lmg.gg/dellprowanclips
Secretlab: https://lmg.gg/secretlablmgclips

Linus and Luke discuss where modern gaming trends are headed, pushing back on the idea that open-world and live-service mechanics are “new” while debating why players seem so hostile to games that don’t fit current expectations. They argue that while big studios feel stagnant, smaller splinter teams and indie developers are driving some of the most exciting games right now.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EfQyfM0oQnk

title: Is Gaming Getting Worse?

author: LMG Clips
description:
Thanks to our LMG clips sponsors dbrand, Dell, and Secretlab. You can check them out at the links below:

dbrand: https://dbrand.com/pcb
Dell: https://lmg.gg/dellprowanclips
Secretlab: https://lmg.gg/secretlablmgclips

Linus and Luke discuss Australia’s new ban on social media for users under 16, breaking down which platforms are affected, why some major services like Discord and Roblox were excluded, and how the law is being framed as a child-safety measure. They question whether the ban will actually work, talk about how kids will likely get around it, and share their own views on parental responsibility versus government intervention.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EfQyfM0oQnk

title: Australia's Social Media Ban is a Joke
